requirement: The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended outcome(s) of its information security management system.
title: Understanding the Organization and Its Context
description: Ensure that the organization understands its context, including internal and external issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended outcome(s) of its information security management system.
testing_procedures: Review documentation that identifies internal and external issues.
Interview key stakeholders to verify understanding of organizational context.
remediation:
Identify and document internal and external issues affecting the ISMS.
Conduct a SWOT analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.
Document findings in a formal report.
Review and update the report periodically.

requirement: The organization shall determine the interested parties that are relevant to the information security management system and the requirements of these interested parties relevant to information security.
title: Understanding the Needs and Expectations of Interested Parties
description: Identify and understand the needs and expectations of interested parties that are relevant to the information security management system.
testing_procedures: Review the list of identified interested parties and their requirements.
Verify that the needs and expectations of these parties are documented and understood.
remediation:
Identify and document the needs and expectations of interested parties.
Conduct stakeholder interviews to gather requirements.
Document the requirements in a stakeholder analysis report.
Regularly review and update the report to reflect changes.

requirement: The organization shall determine the boundaries and applicability of the information security management system to establish its scope.
title: Determining the Scope of the Information Security Management System
description: Define the boundaries and applicability of the information security management system to establish its scope.
testing_procedures: Review the documented scope of the ISMS.
Verify that the scope includes all relevant areas and processes.
remediation:
Define and document the scope of the ISMS.
Identify all areas and processes that impact information security.
Document the scope in the ISMS policy.
Ensure the scope is communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

requirement: The organization shall establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve an information security management system, in accordance with the requirements of this document.
title: Information Security Management System
description: Establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve an information security management system in accordance with the requirements of the ISO 27001 standard.
testing_procedures: Review the ISMS documentation for compliance with ISO 27001 requirements.
Verify the implementation and maintenance of the ISMS through audits.
remediation:
Develop and maintain an ISMS that meets ISO 27001 requirements.
Develop ISMS policies and procedures.
Implement the ISMS across the organization.
Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance and improvement.

requirement: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the information security management system by ensuring the information security policy and information security objectives are established and are compatible with the strategic direction of the organization.
title: Leadership and Commitment
description: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the information security management system.
testing_procedures: Interview top management to assess their commitment to the ISMS.
Review documentation of management meetings and decisions related to ISMS.
remediation:
Ensure top management demonstrates commitment to the ISMS.
Establish information security policies and objectives.
Align ISMS objectives with the organization's strategic direction.
Conduct regular management reviews of the ISMS.
